meanings.definition: To coat or cover with metal.
meanings.sent1: The artist will metalize the sculpture to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent2: The workers will metalize the car parts to protect them from rust.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if we can metalize our old toys to make them look new again.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight seemed to metalize the entire landscape, turning it into a silver wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith's skillful hands metalize the raw iron into beautiful works of art.

meanings.sent1: The alchemist claimed he could metalize any substance into gold.
meanings.sent2: The intense heat will metalize the ore, transforming it into pure metal.
meanings.sent3: It would be amazing if we could metalize our thoughts into tangible objects.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to metalize the room, brightening up everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand had the power to metalize anything it touched.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old coins will slowly metalize and lose their original shine.
meanings.sent2: The robot's outer shell will metalize as it undergoes the transformation process.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could metalize and join the ranks of the brave superheroes.
meanings.sent4: The icy rain seemed to metalize the tree branches, turning them into glittering silver strands.
meanings.sent5: The cursed prince began to metalize, his skin turning into cold, hard steel.
